snippet: The prompt charge of voluntary manslaughter against a police officer in Charlotte has raised concerns among police groups nationwide, which say the apparent haste could affect police work.
abstract: Decision by Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department in North Carolina to charge Officer Randall Kerrick with voluntary manslaughter after he fatally shot an unarmed man is drawing sharp criticism from police groups and is being followed closely by law enforcement departments across the country; critics call the department's move a rush to judgment and say it will have a chilling effect on officers.
lead_paragraph: The prompt charge of voluntary manslaughter against a police officer in Charlotte has raised concerns among police groups nationwide, which say the apparent haste could affect police work.

headline.main: Police Groups Are Critical of Quickly Filed Charges Against Charlotte Officer
headline.print_headline: Police Groups Are Critical Of Quickly Filed Charges Against Charlotte Officer
